intro: Chelidonium majus f. laciniatum, commonly known as the leafy greater celandine, is a variant of the greater celandine plant. It is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae, characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and lobed leaves. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and along roadsides. It has a long, branched root system and produces a milky latex when the stems or leaves are broken. The lobed leaves of this form are more pronounced and deeply divided compared to the typical variety.
